|Rank=B
|Title=Illustration of the functional anatomy of the facial nerve
|Description=Visualise the motor, sensitive and secretory innervation of the facial nerve
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=14}}
Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

properties.question: Which of the following is the primary function of the facial nerve (Cranial Nerve VII)?
properties.option_a: It controls the movement of the sternocleidomastoid muscle.
properties.option_b: It is responsible for the sensation of taste on the anterior two-thirds of the tongue.
properties.option_c: It regulates the muscles involved in eye movement.
properties.option_d: It controls the muscles of facial expression.
